content.description:
Clip the first bolt of Lucky Boy, then trend right heading up an independent line of bolts.

A few hard moves gain a large left hand jug cobble, then the madness starts.  Crank extremely difficult moves on absolutely horrible holds past two bolts to a 5.11+ finish.

The crux moves felt like V8 or V9 which left me wondering if some key holds have fallen out over the years.  Unless I missed something, or was having a very bad climbing day I would rate this more like mid 5.13.

Solid rock, very hard moves,

Get on it and comment on your experience.
content.protection: Bolts.  Shares anchors with Lucky Boy
content.location: Right of Lucky Boy.  First route left of the small cave on the right side of the Impact Zone Wall.

content.description: Straight forward cobble pulling until the crux at the roof. Clip the bolt under roof at your waist off of huge jugs above and save energy for the last three or four bolts.
content.location: First line of bolts on the Impact Zone - Far left

content.description: Awesome technical climbing in white cobble.  Small holds lead to crux about 3/4 of the way up. Very well protected, sustained and different from the rest.
content.location: Start on left side of small cave feature on the Impact Zone Wall. Two routes right of Bolts not Bitches

content.description: Starts left of busload of faith, Slab start toss from bad hold to jug, then ledge, move right to knee bar, up pancakes and left to crux pulling the lip, jugs to finish.
content.location: Almost straight across from cobble in the sky. Right of all the strip club routes.

content.description: New addition as of Oct. 2013. The first bolt is located by a small  heuco in the wall. The route trends left.  No hard moves on the route, but the pump builds as you reach the anchors.

If you have enjoyed the routes on Ammo Dump make your way into the canyon a little further for some more roped bouldering.

This climb doesn't give in till you've clipped the chains and packs a lot of climbing into a mere 45 feet.

Toehooks and some other fancy footwork can make the first part of the route somewhat easier, but only power will see you through if you're going to redpoint.
content.location:
Busload of Faith is the left route that climbs out the small cave on the Lucky Boy wall.

The best belay position is up the slab a good ways where the actual climbing starts.

content.description: Really good climbing through overhanging jugs, slopers, sidepulls, and a two finger pocket up top.
content.location: 2nd route on the Impact Zone - next to pasties and a g-string

content.description:
A powerful, fingery, and sustained route with quality rock and fun moves.

A bit of squeeze job down low, this route shares a few holds with Grip Tease right at the beginning and then veers right into a sequential crux of underclings, sidepulls, big moves and disappointingly slopey feet.  Make a tough clip, then fight over a small roof using small two and three finger pockets to a very sustained and pumpy section of finger buckets, edges, pockets and slopers that lead over the final roof to the chains of Bolts Not Bitches.

This thing is not over until you are standing on the slab, but even then you could blow the last few moves if you were pumped silly.
content.protection: Bolts.  Shares anchors of Bolts Not Bitches.
content.location: Third route from left on Impact Zone.  Between Grip Tease and Bolts Not Bitches.

content.description: Easy climbing for the first several bolts with a the crux at the top. Really good route.
